intro: Tetragonia strongylocarpa, commonly known as the New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves that are edible and often used in cooking. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by distinctive, four-lobed fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal environments, making it a hardy and resilient species. Its botanical features make it both an ornamental and a useful plant in various ecosystems.
